term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - chemical potential, μB
term.title: chemical potential

item.text: The chemical potential of a substance B in a mixture of substances B, C ... is related to the Gibbs energy G of the mixture by: µB = (∂G/∂nB)T,p,nC≠B is the thermodynamic temperature, p is the pressure and nB, nC, ... are the amounts of substance of B, C, ... . For a pure substance B, the chemical potential µB* is given by: µB* = G*/nB = Gm* is the molar Gibbs energy, and where the superscript * attached to a symbol denotes the property of the pure substance. The superscript Θ or ° attached to a symbol may be used to denote a standard thermodynamic quantity.
